answers.answer: I can see the diabetes and feet connection possibility... But I really Dont know. If you've asked ur doctor/midwife and they have no answers (surprised if they didn't suggest you follow a nutritionist/special diet),  maybe you can consider seeing a podiatrist/orthopedist.! They could be of great help. If you don't get checked now, baby will only keep growing and the baby weight plus your own will only increase the pain. But for now, I say, lay off the heels and flats. Wear something with at least an inch of heel between the front of shoe and back (heel being at the back obviously). I am no doctor but I do have feet issues of my own...those specialists helped me a year ago. I'm 29 weeks and can dance and walk in these feet! All the best mama.

question: Hi, I am in 11th week of my pregnancy.  Was diagnosed with borderline high H1AC, in 4th week,  which calculates sugar level for past three months.Recently developed severe  pain on the arch of my left foot. Makes it difficult for me to stand and walk with pressure on my left foot . what could be the reason?
title: Severe pain on arch of my left foot
